IS OPEN.description: Using HTTP instead of HTTPS can be dangerous when exchanging sensitive data

PUT METHOD ALLOWED.send:
PUT / HTTP/1.1
Host: host:port
Connection: close

DELETE METHOD ALLOWED.send:
DELETE / HTTP/1.1
Host: host:port
Connection: close

SHELLSHOCK.description: We can use arbitrary headers to access the website
SHELLSHOCK.send:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: host:port
User-Agent: () { :;}; /bin/bash -c 'echo SHELLSHOCK!!'

HTTP STRICT TRANSPORT SECURITY HEADER MI.description: The HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) feature enables a web server to inform the userâ€™s browser, via a special response header, that it should never establish an unencrypted HTTP connection to the specified domain servers. Instead, it should automatically establish all connection requests to access the site through HTTPS. This also prevents users from overriding certificate errors.
HTTP STRICT TRANSPORT SECURITY HEADER MI.send:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: host:port
Connection: close

NO SECURE FLAG IN COOKIE.description: Using cookies and not setting the Secure parameter can be a major security vulnerability
NO SECURE FLAG IN COOKIE.send:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: host:port
Connection: close

NO HTTPONLY FLAG IN COOKIE.description: If a cookies is used and not setting the HttpOnly parameter can be a major security vulnerability
NO HTTPONLY FLAG IN COOKIE.send:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: host:port
Connection: close
